instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.TPS51125: What is TPS51125? This is a power chip responsible for the PP3V3_S5,  PP5V_S5,  and PP5V_S3 power rails on many A1278 model Macbooks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchpad/keyboard/usb on battery
threads.message:
hi, 
         kindly advise as this board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> had little liquid damage . it works completely fine when charger plugged in with the battery . as soon as we remove the charger the  touchpad , usbs and the keyboard all stop working and if we plug in the charger back  it starts working again . 
thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchpad/keyboard/usb on battery
threads.message:
Run EFI ASD.
Let see if any error appears...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchpad/keyboard/usb on battery
threads.message: Where was the liquid damage? Possible 5V issue so was there crap around <CHIP>TPS51125</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no touchpad/keyboard/usb on battery
threads.message:
hi , 
  Efi asd passed and no error to report , i will look at the <CHIP>TPS51125</CHIP> area again .
thanks
